item.description:
Why do people in America become very sick more now than ever before?

Death in America is largely a foodborne illness. Focusing on studies published just over the last year in peer-reviewed scientific medical journals, Michael Greger MD offers practical advice on how best to feed ourselves and our families to prevent, treat, and even reverse many of the top 15 killers in the United States.

He will extensively cover the latest research on heart disease and cancer as well as research on stroke, kidney & lung diseases.

Examples of studies to be discussed include:

The 35 year Harvard Nurses Study, which is the most extensive study relating
lifestyle and diet to health and longevity to date.  Among other things, the study results compare the negative impacts of smoking and egg consumption to the positive impacts of exercise, nut and oat consumption.

Multiple studies that suggest inflammation of the artery walls associated with meat and dairy consumption is caused by toxins created by bacteria in animal products (the toxins do not break down when cooked).


The video presentation is 55 minutes. After the showing there will be some time for discussion.

See: http://www.fpc-stow-acton.org/article/video-presentation-uprooting-leading-causes-death
